Konstantinos Kogkalidis

Happily Unemployed
Hey!

I am Kokos (he/him).

After 4+ years of working on my PhD under the supervision of Michael Moortgat, I recently submitted my dissertation titled Dependency as Modality, Parsing as Permutation: A Neurosymbolic Perspective on Categorial Grammars. You can find a pre-review version here. Previously, I received a master's degree in Artificial Intelligence from Utrecht University while working as a machine learning engineer at geekbot.io. Even previously, I received my diploma in Electrical & Computer Enginering from the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki.

My research interests revolve around type-driven methods for syntactic parsing and semantic compositionality. I am especially interested in the intersection of formal and data-driven methods; if that floats your boat rubber duck, you can have a look at my publications page.

Recent & Upcoming Talks

Here's a list of my recent and upcoming talks (more here):
  • Neurosymbolic Proof Search for Linguistics
    September 16, 2022 in Como
    Presentation @ Logic for the AI Spring
  • The Unicorn of Constant Time Parsing
    August 22, 2022 in Galway
    Presentation @ End-to-End Compositional Models of Vector-Based Semantics (ESSLLI 2022)
  • Logic-Based Parsing with Neural Networks
    August 17, 2022 in Galway
    Lecture @ Compositional Models of Vector-based Semantics (ESSLLI 2022)
  • Supertagging Beyond Trees with Heterogeneous Dynamic Convolutions
    June 17, 2022 in Tilburg
    Presentation @ The 32nd Meeting of Computational Linguistics in the Netherlands

Teaching

I am not currenly teaching. Previously, I taught the 2020 edition of the Logic & Language course in the AI Master's programme of Utrecht University.
Aside that, I assisted in various capacities with the following courses:
  • Compositional Models of Vector-Based Semantics (ESSLLI 2022, lecture)
  • Logic & Language (2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2021-2022, lectures & project supervision)
  • Machine Learning for Human Vision & Language (2019-2020, tutorials)
  • Advanced Topics in Cognitive Modelling (2018-2019, tutorials)

About Me
I like ducks, drone metal, machine learning and type theory (in no particular order). I don't know much about either of these subjects.
